title: Session #1 Decarbonization in emerging economies (energy transition)
speaker:
1.	• Simon Stiell, Executive Secretary of UNFCCC
2.	• Fatih Birol, Head of IEA
3.	• Damilola Ogunbiyi,  CEO and Special Representative of the UN Secretary-General (UN SRSG) for Sustainable Energy for All, and Co-Chair of UN-Energy (One of the biggest advocate of UN Sustainable Development Goal no 7: Access to reliable, affordable, sustainable, and modern energy for all by 2030)
4.	• Jorge Moreira da Silva, Executive Director of UNOPS, Former Portuguese Ministry of Environment, Territorial Planning and Energy 
5.	• Salvatore Bernabei, CEO of Enel Green Power, Chairman of Global Alliance for Sustainable Energy (Enel Green Power is a multinational renewable energy company (wind, solar, geothermal, hydro). Global Alliance for Sustainable Energy focuses on including ‘just transition’ principles in the renewable energy industry.)
6.	• Darren Woods, CEO of ExxonMobil (one of the leading companies in CCUS implementation)
7.	Mads Nipper, CEO of Orsted 
(Largest Danish energy company. World’s largest developer of offshore wind power by number of built offshore wind farms)
8.	Scott L. Strazik, CEO GE Vernova
(GE’s portfolio of energy businesses. One of the largest producer of wind and gas turbine globally) 
9.	John Moore, CEO of Bloomberg NEF 
(BNEF provide analysis and insights for decarbonization efforts)
10.	Jennifer Layke, Chair of Asia Clean Energy Coalition (ACEC) 
(ACEC convenes leading businesses to advocate 
11.	Salvatore Bernabei, CEO of Enel Green Power, Chairman of Global Alliance for Sustainable Energy (Advocate for ‘just transition’ principles and social responsibility in the RE industry)
12.	Dr. Jennifer Kurtz, Director of NREL's Energy Conversion and Storage Systems Center (Expert on the future of energy storage system, crucial for RE scale-up)
